summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding a hearing about Jeffrey Epstein's computer equipment. It notes that Judge Marra has scheduled a hearing for the following Tuesday at 9:00 AM, and that a witness is due to appear before the grand jury that afternoon.

persons.name: Judge Marra
persons.context: The judge who scheduled a hearing regarding Jeffrey Epstein's computer equipment for the following Tuesday at 9:00 AM.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: The attorney the email sender is calling, presumably in relation to the hearing about Epstein's computer equipment.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the hearing, which concerns his computer equipment. He is the central figure in the case.

connections.description: Roy Black is being contacted by the prosecutor, indicating he is likely acting as Epstein's defense attorney in the matter concerning the computer equipment.
Judge Marra is presiding over a legal hearing related to Epstein's computer equipment.

events.title: Hearing on Epstein's Computer Equipment
events.description: A hearing scheduled by Judge Marra regarding Jeffrey Epstein's computer equipment, set for 9:00 AM.

events.title: Grand Jury Witness Testimony
events.description: A witness is scheduled to appear before the grand jury in the afternoon on the same day as the hearing.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400 West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: A hearing regarding Jeffrey Epstein's computer equipment was scheduled by Judge Marra for September 18, 2007.
A witness was due to testify before a grand jury on the same afternoon as the hearing.
Prosecutors were contacting defense attorney Roy Black in relation to the hearing.
The correspondence indicates active grand jury proceedings and evidence collection (computer equipment) in the Epstein case in September 2007.
